title: JavaScript For Loops
description: Learn the fundamentals of 'for' loops in JavaScript.

components.title: What is a 'for' loop?
Knowledge Check
components.question: Which part of a 'for' loop is executed only once, before the loop starts?
components.explanation: The initialization part (e.g., `let i = 0`) is executed only a single time at the very beginning to set up the loop's counter variable.

components.title: Code Lab: Your First Loop
components.task: Modify the code to print numbers from 1 to 10 (inclusive).

components.title: Final Quiz
components.question: What will be the final value of `i` logged to the console in this loop? `for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) { console.log(i); }`
components.explanation: The loop runs for i = 0, 1, and 2. When i becomes 3, the condition `i < 3` is false, so the loop terminates. The last value logged was 2.
